intro: Phaeneilema polyanthum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered phaeneilema, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
